info.title: Adapter API
info.description: The API contract is defined using a standard OpenAPI specification to simplify adapter development.

post.description: This should return a list of properly formed endpoint URL(s) (https://ip address) this adapter instance is expected to communicate with. List of URLs will be used for taking advantage of the vRealize Operations Manager certificate trust system. If the list is empty this means adapter will handle certificates manully.

ObjectKey.title: ObjectKey
ObjectKey.description:
Represents a key to uniquely identify a object in the system. A key's
uniqueness depends on its object kind, adapter kind, and either the
object name or additional "uniqueness" identifiers.

See {Identifier} for information about object identifiers.

A object key includes the object name as part of the key's uniqueness if
it has no identifiers marked as part of uniqueness; otherwise, it includes
the identifiers marked as part of uniqueness instead of the object name.

All components used to determine uniqueness are compared in a case-insensitive way.

The following shows how to add two objects, by objectKey, to a discovery
result.  The first is created with no identifiers.  The second is created
with two identifiers, one of which plays a part in uniquely identifying the
object and the other which is for informational purposes only.

name.description: Name of the object this key represents

adapterKind.description: Adapter kind key this key represents.

objectKind.description: The object kind key this key represents.

identifiers.description: Collection of identifiers for this key. Identifiers are case insensitive. No two identifiers with the same key can exist for the same resource.

Identifier.title: Identifier
Identifier.description:
Stores the adapter object's identifier configuration.
An identifier can either be an active identifier or an informational identifier.
All active identifiers have the flag "isPartOfUniqueness" set to true, 
while all informational identifiers have this flag set to false. In the product,
there cannot be more than one object with the same values for all active identifiers.
This class contains all information about the object identifier.

key.description: Key for the object identifier. For a object kind, identifier keys are unique. In describe.xml file, the attribute "key" corresponds to this field. This is a case-insensitive field and can not be empty.

value.description: Value of the object identifier. This is a case-insensitive field

isPartOfUniqueness.description: Flag to indicate whether the identifier should be considered for object's uniqueness. If a object has multiple identifiers that are part of uniqueness, there can be only one combination of values of those identifiers in vRealize Operations.

ObjectData.title: ObjectData
ObjectData.description: Stores object configuration information. Collection of metrics/properties for the object and the object key for current object.

MetricData.title: MetricData
MetricData.description: Represents a single data for a given metric, where an data is a time-stamp and a value;

key.description:
Key represents a hierarchical structure for an individual metric. The formation of the metric key is an important part of designing a data feed. Well formed metric keys will lead to better usability, performance and visualization of analytics results, such as root cause analysis. The base concepts are as follows:
A metric key can consist of any number of hierarchical groups. Each hierarchical group can contain instances. The last item in the hierarchy is assumed to be the name of the metric. The hierarchy without instance names represents an attribute that can be collected. If there are no instances, then a metric key and an attribute are one and the same.

PropertyData.title: PropertyData
PropertyData.description: Represents a single data for a given property, where the value can be numeric or string type.

CollectResult.title: CollectResult
CollectResult.description: Result of the collection process. Every collect result has object data collection with metrics/properties and the relationship of all objects.

result.description: Collection of collected objects with metrics and properties.

relationships.description: Collection of objects relationships with parent to children structure.

ObjectRelationship.title: ObjectRelationship
ObjectRelationship.description: Represents a single parent to many children relationship.

children.description: Collection of children for the current parent.

TestResult.title: TestResult
TestResult.description: Represents the configuration validation result. Result contains error message if validation is failed.

errorMessage.description: Contains the error message if the test connection failed.

AdapterConfig.title: AdapterConfig
AdapterConfig.description:
Is designed for transferring adapter instance configuration from the Collector to
Adapter, containing all necessary information about connection parameters, credentials.

CredentialConfig.title: CredentialConfig
CredentialConfig.description:
Represents the adapter's configured credential object. 
Contains all information about the credentials entered when the adapter instance is created.

credentialKey.description: Credential configuration key. In describe.xml file, the "key" attribute corresponds to this field.

credentialFields.description: List of all credential field configurations. In describe.xml, the element "CredentialField" inside "CredentialKind" corresponds to individual elements in this list.

CredentialField.title: CredentialField
CredentialField.description:
Represents adapter's credential configuration field.
This class contains all information about the credential's field entered when the adapter instance is created.

key.description: Credential field key. In describe.xml file, the "key" attribute corresponds to this field.

value.description: Value of the credential field. This field is populated  on adapter instance creation.

isPassword.description: Flag to indicate whether this is a password field.

InternalRestCredential.title: InternalRestCredential
InternalRestCredential.description: Represents the credential object to be used by adapter to communicate with vR Ops.

userName.description: Represents the user name in the credential.

password.description: Represents the password in the credential.

Certificate.title: Certificate
Certificate.description: Represents the adapter's trusted certificate object. This class contains all information about the certificates trusted by user from UI when the adapter instance is created.

isInvalidHostnameAccepted.description:
In case if the hostname verification fails and isInvalidHostnameAccepted is true 
Adapter should do the verification by comparing the certificates from the endpoints with the certificates received from the Collector. 
For example the comparison can be done by thumbprint.

isExpiredCertificateAccepted.description: In case if the connection fails because of certificate expiration and isExpiredCertificateAccepted is true then the Adapter should ignore that failure and continue the connection.
